page.title: 06CROPS
page.content: There are three kinds of crops grown in this area. They are wheat, barley and potatoes. Out of these the most common is potatoes and then barley and wheat. When our barley and wheat is harvested it goes to Sharrocks mill near Woodplumpton, Where it is made into provin which are pellets for cows, calves etc. The barley and wheat is harvested in September to October. It is planted between April and May. Some farms during the Winter also grow barley,this provides straw during the Winter straw is the remainder of the barley after its been thrashed of barley.Potatoes are grown during the Summer. They are picked and planted about the same time as barley.Our potatoes are sold to wholesalers who buy four or five tonnes at a time. Then they are sold on the market, a place where things are bought or sold.
